channel.title: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][b]Project Fallout[/b][/size] By Cres[/center]
[b][size=10pt][u]General Information[/u][/size][/b] You find yourself in a corrupt world , loose from any rules , where humanity has strained far from reason. You don't know why you're here , but you know that surviving these lands won't be easy.
Project Fallout is based upon the Apocalypse-based game [b]Fallout 3[/b] by [b]Bethesda Softworks[/b]. The story goes as follows : ( skip to the GamePlay section if you don't like poorly written storylines :p )
The several Nations in the world of Gielinor have sought battle with eachother , for economic and political reasons. At first , the barbarians tried to invade Varock because they didn't have any food left , they were stopped brutally by the King. The Fremennik , related to the barbarians , sought revenge and engaged further battle with Varock. When Varock was finaly invaded by the Fremenik , Falador tried to end their act of revenge. Whilst Falador was attacking the Fremeniks in Varock , their city got attacked by the army of Bandos ( consisting from ogres , goblins , and such ). They had answered the call of the Fremeniks who knew they couldn't fight off Falador. When the knights of Falador finally made the Fremeniks surrender , they found that their homecity was invaded by the Bandos army. The knights of Falador sought further help from the king of Ardougne and more of the western laid kingdoms ( Elves ). Many other armies picked a side in this final battle , which eventually had reduced the world's population to half. At last , the King of Ardougne won the war , at the cost of more then 5 entire civilations. When they returned to their hometown , the inevidable happened. A group of elitist anarchists saw the sudden apocalyptic war between the nations as their chance to strike down the authorities whilst they were weakened. The King of Ardougne and his army were stopped there.
At current time , there is no such thing as 'Personal Possesion' , it's yours if you can defend it.
[size=10pt][u][b]GamePlay[/b][/u][/size] The main event is combat between players , there aren't any monsters to train on , there are however certain training oppurtunities in certain cities.
Most skills won't be trainable , whereas other skills shall be crucial to your survival.
To maintain some sort of order , you cannot attack other players inside banks , on any other area players will be able to attack you , and vice-versa offcourse.
Items for warfare can be bought from travelling merchants , or you can attempt to get the primary resources yourself ( this will include the risk of getting attacked by players ).
[size=10pt][u][b]Bosses and PvM support[/b][/u][/size] The generals of the armies of the gods have been hidden , due to respect of their almost extinct races. If you find yourself lucky , you may find the entrance to their hideouts. A special note about these bosses is that they must be killed personally , you cannot rely on the help of your friends ( if you even manage to make those in this world ).
These bosses shall drop items devoted to their gods. ( Godswords , god armour , etc... ).
[size=10pt][b][u]Development[/u][/b][/size]
Progress List : [code] 25/6/2011 * Deleted EVERYTHING contentwise , the source is basically empty now. * Finished writing safespots , all banks are safe now. * Added PvP combat outside banks ( no level difference ). * Added random respawning inside the banks ( you spawn in a random safe bank )
26/6/2011 * Added first training spot * Added PKP and BossPoints * Added a transportation system with portals * Added a minigame , uses tokkul , gives defenders * Added merchants , selling general items outside safespots inside the main cities
27/6/2011 * Mole Tunnels are now safe * Added a trading area ( so players will know where to go if they want to buy anything from eachother ) The trading area is also safe. * Re-added Woodcutting , used the version i released earlier * Started re-writing Crafting
28/6/2011 * Started on the portals ; they now change location according to a timer , their locations are random ( chosen between a set of pre-decided locations ). [/code]
[b][u][size=10pt]Media[/size][/u][/b]
Custom Minigame : Warrior's Guild ( from previous project ) : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Fg-1huCxKg
[img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/pvpmerch.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/npcportal.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/molehills.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/minigame.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/safebank.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/cavestory.jpg[/img] [img]http://i832.photobucket.com/albums/zz247/Musa_Kapan/cavetrain.jpg[/img]
This project will take a while , on a side note , this is the first project i shall host online. All the others were mainly for learning purposes :p

item.title: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:12, topic:400862”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=497918.msg3642538#msg3642538 date=1309120442]
Sounds pretty badass. You should make the “traveling merchants” have a walking range of like 200+ lol, so players have to find them. ;D (clip them of course, unless you want them walking on water. :eek:)
[/quote]

Actually , that would make it more fun , they’d have to wait for them to get back to land xD
For now tey are just central inside the cities

As stated before , there isn’t really anything I can show via pictures ; so i’ll make some right now xD

I love these types of servers, however your story seems a bit stupid (no offense) and the gameplay makes it seem like it would be boring very quickly.

Let me expand your vision ; This will be your average PI , minus poorly written content , plus the PvP everywhere , you will still be able to train skills , but you will always have the risk of getting attacked.

I’m planning to perfect and re-write all the skills , the thing is :
When you finally achieve somthing like a high wealth status or a 99 in a skill it will feel ALOT more accomplishing then it would on your average PI.

Pictures have been added.[/quote]

Add my msn: r0cker_days@hotmail.com

I can give you some details about the server I was going to create that was like this.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight

item.title: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Thx
Haven’t done anything today , it was WAY too hot to barely move an inch without sweating , imagine trying to code…
I’m also dry on ideas , so the next thing that shall receive my full attention shall be the bosses and that portal moving around

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

halflive9:

Good luck. Will you making your own bosses or use existing bosses?

I’ll use the existing bosses , every kill will give you a rare item guaranteed ; you can only kill 1 boss every 1 hour because the portal that leads to the bosses can only be accessed by 1 person.

The portal shall change location every 1 hour.

item.title: [PI] Fallout , Fight to Live , Live to Fight
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[center][size=14pt]Project Fallout[/size]
By Cres[/center]

[size=10pt]General Information[/size]
You find yourself in a corrupt world , loose from any rules , where humanity has strained far from reason.
You don’t know why you’re here , but you know that surviving these lands won’t be easy.

Project Fallout is based upon the Apocalypse-based game Fallout 3 by Bethesda Softworks.
The story goes as follows : ( skip to the GamePlay section if you don’t like poorly written storylines )

The several Nations in the world of Gielinor have sought battle with eachother , for economic and political reasons.
At first , the barbarians tried to invade Varock because they didn’t have any food left , they were stopped brutally by the King.
The Fremennik , related to the barbarians , sought revenge and engaged further battle with Varock.
When Varock was finaly invaded by the Fremenik , Falador tried to end their act of revenge.
Whilst Falador was attacking the Fremeniks in Varock , their city got attacked by the army of Bandos ( consisting from ogres , goblins , and such ).
They had answered the call of the Fremeniks who knew they couldn’t fight off Falador.
When the knights of Falador finally made the Fremeniks surrender , they found that their homecity was invaded by the Bandos army.
The knights of Falador sought further help from the king of Ardougne and more of the western laid kingdoms ( Elves ).
Many other armies picked a side in this final battle , which eventually had reduced the world’s population to half.
At last , the King of Ardougne won the war , at the cost of more then 5 entire civilations.
When they returned to their hometown , the inevidable happened.
A group of elitist anarchists saw the sudden apocalyptic war between the nations as their chance to strike down the authorities whilst they were weakened.
The King of Ardougne and his army were stopped there.

At current time , there is no such thing as ‘Personal Possesion’ , it’s yours if you can defend it.

[size=10pt]GamePlay[/size]
The main event is combat between players , there aren’t any monsters to train on , there are however certain training oppurtunities in certain cities.

Most skills won’t be trainable , whereas other skills shall be crucial to your survival.

To maintain some sort of order , you cannot attack other players inside banks , on any other area players will be able to attack you , and vice-versa offcourse.

Items for warfare can be bought from travelling merchants , or you can attempt to get the primary resources yourself ( this will include the risk of getting attacked by players ).

[size=10pt]Bosses and PvM support[/size]
The generals of the armies of the gods have been hidden , due to respect of their almost extinct races.
If you find yourself lucky , you may find the entrance to their hideouts.
A special note about these bosses is that they must be killed personally , you cannot rely on the help of your friends ( if you even manage to make those in this world ).

These bosses shall drop items devoted to their gods. ( Godswords , god armour , etc… ).

[size=10pt]Development[/size]

Progress List :

25/6/2011
* Deleted EVERYTHING contentwise , the source is basically empty now.
* Finished writing safespots , all banks are safe now.
* Added PvP combat outside banks ( no level difference ).
* Added random respawning inside the banks ( you spawn in a random safe bank )

26/6/2011
* Added first training spot
* Added PKP and BossPoints
* Added a transportation system with portals
* Added a minigame , uses tokkul , gives defenders
* Added merchants , selling general items outside safespots inside the main cities

27/6/2011
* Mole Tunnels are now safe
* Added a trading area ( so players will know where to go if they want to buy anything from eachother )
The trading area is also safe.
* Re-added Woodcutting , used the version i released earlier
* Started re-writing Crafting

28/6/2011
* Started on the portals ; they now change location according to a timer , their locations are random ( chosen between a set of pre-decided locations ).

[size=10pt]Media[/size]

Custom Minigame : Warrior’s Guild ( from previous project ) :

pvpmerch.jpg764×505

npcportal.jpg767×504

molehills.jpg767×505

minigame.jpg766×506

safebank.jpg767×507

cavestory.jpg765×502

cavetrain.jpg766×504

This project will take a while , on a side note , this is the first project i shall host online.
All the others were mainly for learning purposes
